real property that is owned by the Carney Rod and Gun Club;
real property improvements that promote business redevelopment, for which credit:

subparagraph.text: the governing body shall define by law what improvements are eligible; and
on reassessment by the supervisor, the governing body shall determine the credit as a percentage of the actual cost of the improvements;

paragraph.text: each unit of a condominium (as both are defined in § 11–101 of the Real Property Article), if:

subparagraph.text: the governing body of the county consults with the council of unit owners (as defined in § 11–101 of the Real Property Article) of the condominium; and
the council of unit owners provides services or maintains common elements (as defined in § 11–101 of the Real Property Article) that would otherwise be the responsibility of the county;

paragraph.text: dwellings, the land on which the dwelling is located and other improvements to the land if:

subparagraph.text: the dwelling is in a homeowners’ association where the dwelling has a declaration of covenants or restrictive covenants that may be enforced by an association of members;
the governing body of the county consults with the homeowners’ association; and
the governing body of the county determines that the homeowners’ association provides services that would otherwise be the responsibility of the county;

paragraph.text: real property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by the Rosa Ponselle Charitable Foundation, Incorporated, known as “Villa Pace”; and
not exempt under this article;

paragraph.text: agricultural land, not including any improvements, that is located in an agricultural preservation district;
real property that is owned by Friends of the Oliver House, Inc.;
real property that is owned by the Bird River Beach Community Association, Inc.;
real property that is owned by Harewood Park Community League, Inc.;
real property that is owned by any other nonprofit community association, civic league or organization, or recreational or athletic organization;
personal property that is owned by the Genesee Valley Outdoor Learning Center, Inc.;
real property that is owned by The Maryland State Game and Fish Protective Association, Inc.;
personal property that is owned by Leadership Through Athletics, Inc.;
real property that is owned by the Loreley Beach Community Association;
real property that is owned by Civic League of Inverness, Inc.; and
real property that is owned by the Rosewald Beach Civic League.
A property owner is not eligible for a tax credit for agricultural land under subsection (b) of this section, and any such tax credit granted shall terminate, if the property owner:

subparagraph.text: sells an easement over the property to the State; or
terminates the agricultural preservation district agreement.

paragraph.text: A property owner who has been granted a property tax credit for agricultural land under subsection (b) of this section, and who subsequently terminates the agricultural preservation district agreement shall be liable for:

subparagraph.text: all property taxes that the owner would have been liable for if a property tax credit had not been granted under this section for a period not exceeding 10 years from the date that the agricultural preservation agreement was recorded;
interest on the total tax liability as required under § 14-605 of this article; and
a tax penalty as required under § 14-703 of this article.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Baltimore County or of a municipal corporation in Baltimore County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on property owned by the Gunpowder Valley Conservancy, Inc. that is used:

subparagraph.text: to assist in the preservation of a natural area;
for the environmental education of the public;
generally to promote conservation; or
for the maintenance of:

sub-subparagraph.text: a natural area for public use; or
a sanctuary for wildlife.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Baltimore County or of a municipal corporation in Baltimore County may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the amount and duration of the property tax credit under this section; and
any other provision necessary to carry out the property tax credit under this section.

subsection.text: The governing body of Calvert County and of a municipal corporation in Calvert County shall grant a tax credit under this section against the county and municipal corporation property tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: real property that is owned by the Calvert Arundel Medical Facility, Incorporated; and
agricultural land, not including any improvements, that is located in an agricultural preservation district.

subsection.text: The governing body of Calvert County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: real property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by a nonprofit community or civic improvement association or corporation; and
used only for a community, civic, educational, or library purpose, if:

sub-subparagraph.text: unless the compensation is used only to improve or maintain the property, the use is not contingent on the payment of compensation; and
unless the compensation is used only to improve or maintain the property, failure to pay compensation is not a reason to deny admission to or use of the property;

paragraph.text: real property that is owned by the Calvert County Sportsmen’s Club, Incorporated; and
real property that is:

subparagraph.text: located in the 2nd election district of Calvert County;
actually used for the Calvert County Fair; and
known as the Calvert County Fairgrounds.

subsection.text: The governing body of Calvert County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on a building that is:

paragraph.text: located on land that qualifies for an agricultural use assessment; and
used in connection with an activity that is recognized by the Department as an approved agricultural activity.

subsection.text: The governing body of Calvert County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property that is:

paragraph.text: owned by the Huntingtown Volunteer Fire Department and Rescue Squad, Incorporated; and
leased to the United States Postal Service for use as a post office.

subsection.text: The governing body of Calvert County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property that is owned by the Calvert Post No. 85, the American Legion Department of Maryland, Incorporated.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Calvert County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property that is owned by members of volunteer fire and rescue companies.
The governing body of Calvert County may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the amount and duration of the tax credit under this subsection; and
the criteria for qualifying for the tax credit under this subsection.

Subject to subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, the governing body of Calvert County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property owned by an expanding or new business that:

sub-subparagraph.text: employs at least 25 new additional full-time employees, the salaries for which must be greater than the county annual average salary in the economic development target market sector, as determined by the county; and
acquires at least $2,500,000 in land, improvements to the land, or equipment in the county.

subparagraph.text: If the expanding or new business is engaged in the generation of electricity, the credit under this section may be granted against the county property tax imposed on personal property and real property owned by the expanding or new business.

paragraph.text: The tax credit under this section shall be granted to:

subparagraph.text: a business that owns the land and building it occupies within the county; or
any party responsible for paying the real property taxes on all or part of the land or building.

paragraph.text: The amount of the credit may not exceed 50% of the amount of property tax due in any taxable year.
The governing body of Calvert County may define, fix, or limit the amount, terms, scope, and duration of any credit provided for or affirmed under this subsection.

subsection.text: The governing body of Caroline County and of a municipal corporation in Caroline County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county and municipal corporation property tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: property that is owned by the Eastern Shore Threshermen and Collectors Association, Incorporated;
property that is owned by the Marshyhope Rod and Gun Club, Incorporated; and
property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by the Maryland Ornithological Society, Incorporated; and
used only to:

sub-subparagraph.text: protect, preserve, and perpetuate plants and wildlife that are unique to the area; and
teach, research, and specially study plants and wildlife that are unique to the area.

subsection.text: The governing body of Caroline County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on property that is owned by the Community Civic League, Incorporated, at its day care center facility.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Caroline County may grant, by law, a property tax credit not exceeding 75% of the county property tax imposed on agricultural land that:

subparagraph.text: is included in an agricultural preservation district established under § 2–509 of the Agriculture Article; and
meets any additional requirements that the county governing body establishes.

paragraph.text: If a property tax credit is granted under this subsection and the agricultural preservation district agreement is subsequently terminated, the owner of the property who terminates the agreement is liable to Caroline County for a penalty equal to 5 times the amount of the credit provided for the most recent taxable year in which the credit was granted.
The governing body of Caroline County may provide, by law, any procedural or enforcement provision necessary to carry out this subsection.
The governing body of Caroline County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on personal property.
A law adopted under paragraph (1) of this subsection may provide for:

subparagraph.text: the amount of a credit;
the subclasses of personal property under § 8–101(c) of this article to which the credit applies; and
other provisions necessary to administer the credit.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Caroline County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on real property that:

subparagraph.text: is owned by Caroline County Habitat for Humanity, Incorporated with the intention of relinquishing ownership in the immediate future;
is used exclusively for the purpose of rehabilitation and transfer to a private owner; and
is not occupied by administrative or warehouse buildings owned by Caroline County Habitat for Humanity, Incorporated.

paragraph.text: The Caroline County Habitat for Humanity, Incorporated shall submit an annual written report to the governing body of Caroline County documenting:

subparagraph.text: all of Caroline County Habitat for Humanity, Incorporated’s real property holdings in Caroline County; and
all transactions involving Caroline County Habitat for Humanity, Incorporated’s real property holdings in Caroline County.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Caroline County may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the amount of a property tax credit under this subsection;
the duration of a property tax credit under this subsection; and
any other provision necessary to carry out this subsection.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Carroll County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county tax imposed on:

subparagraph.text: real property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: owned by a nonprofit community or civic improvement association or corporation; and
used only for a community, civic, educational, or library purpose, if:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: unless the compensation is used only to improve or maintain the property, the use is not contingent on the payment of compensation; and
unless the compensation is used only to improve or maintain the property, failure to pay compensation is not a reason to deny admission to or use of the property; and

subparagraph.text: real property on which an improvement is made to an existing structure that is located in a historic district.

paragraph.text: A property tax credit granted under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection shall be:

subparagraph.text: the following percentage of the increase that is due to the improvement:

sub-subparagraph.text: 100% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 1st and 2nd taxable years that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax;
80% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 3rd taxable year that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax;
60% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 4th taxable year that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax; and
40% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 5th taxable year that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax; and

subparagraph.text: ended after the 5th taxable year that the improved structure is subject to county property tax.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Carroll County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on:

subparagraph.text: real property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: owned by the Maryland Jaycees Foundation, Incorporated, of Carroll County; and
located at 602 Johahn Drive in Westminster, Maryland; and

subparagraph.text: real property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: leased by the Sykesville Little League, Incorporated;
located east of Obrecht Road in the 5th election district of Carroll County; and
used only by the Sykesville Little League, Incorporated.

paragraph.text: A property tax credit granted under paragraph (1)(i) of this subsection shall continue in effect until the property is conveyed.

The governing body of Carroll County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on real property used as a principal residence and owned by certain classes of individuals, as specified by the governing body of Carroll County, who are at least 65 years old and who are of limited income.
The governing body of Carroll County may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: eligibility criteria for the credit under this subsection;
the amount and duration of the tax credit under this subsection;
regulations and procedures for the application and uniform processing of requests for the tax credit; and
any other provision necessary to carry out the credit under this section.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Carroll County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on real property that is:

subparagraph.text: located in designated geographic regions of the county;
owned by specified classes of persons; and
renovated, upgraded, or rehabilitated in accordance with eligibility criteria established by the county.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Carroll County, by law, may:

subparagraph.text: specify the geographic areas of the county, classes of owners, and types of improvements to property eligible for the tax credit;
establish the amount and duration of the tax credit;
establish eligibility criteria for the tax credit; and
provide for any other provision necessary to carry out the tax credit under this section.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Carroll County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on property on which a person installs environmentally friendly or “green” technologies, including conserving water, incorporating recycled or recyclable materials, and incorporating renewable and energy efficient power generation.
The governing body, by law, may:

subparagraph.text: set the amount of the tax credit;
establish eligibility criteria for the tax credit;
establish the type of work that shall qualify for the tax credit;
establish the type of environmental technologies that will qualify for the tax credit; and
set forth regulations and procedures for the application and uniform processing of requests for the tax credit.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, “independent living retirement community” means a community or facility for the aged that:

sub-subparagraph.text: provides continuing care as defined in § 10–401 of the Human Services Article;
is licensed as a related institution under Title 19, Subtitle 3 of the Health – General Article;
is certified by the Department of Aging; and

is exempt from federal income tax under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code or is owned or operated by a person that is exempt from federal income tax under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code; or

subparagraph.text: offers an age–restricted life occupancy agreement and requires payment of an entrance fee.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Carroll County or of a municipal corporation in Carroll County may grant, by law, a tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on that portion of the real property owned by an independent living retirement community that is used as housing units.
The governing body of Carroll County or of a municipal corporation in Carroll County may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the amount and duration of the tax credit under this subsection;
additional eligibility criteria for the tax credit under this subsection;
regulations and procedures for the application and uniform processing of requests for the tax credit under this subsection; and
any other provision necessary to carry out the tax credit under this subsection.

paragraph.text: If the governing body of Carroll County or of a municipal corporation in Carroll County authorizes a tax credit under this subsection, the full benefit of the tax credit shall be assigned to residents of the independent living retirement community.

subsection.text: The governing body of Cecil County and of a municipal corporation in Cecil County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county and municipal corporation property tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: property that is owned by the Society for the Preservation of Maryland Antiquities, Incorporated; and
property that is owned by the Friends of the Library of Cecil County, Maryland, Incorporated.

subsection.text: The governing body of Cecil County or of a municipal corporation in Cecil County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: property that is owned by the Upper Chesapeake Watershed Association and is used:

subparagraph.text: to assist in the preservation of a wild nature area;
to establish a nature reserve or other protected area; or
generally to promote conservation;

paragraph.text: property that is owned by an incorporated, nonprofit fire company or rescue squad, if the property:

subparagraph.text: is leased for more than 60 days during any 12–month period under a contractual agreement for the operation of the fire company’s fire hall; and
would qualify for the exemption under § 7–209 of this article if leased for not more than 60 days during any 12–month period; and

paragraph.text: property that:

subparagraph.text: is owned by:

sub-subparagraph.text: a little league organization in Cecil County; or
a nonprofit organization that allows a little league organization of Cecil County to use their property for youth amateur athletics; and

subparagraph.text: is actually used exclusively for the purposes of a little league organization of Cecil County.

paragraph.text: The governing body of a municipal corporation in Cecil County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the municipal corporation property tax imposed on residential real property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by an individual serving as a member of a volunteer fire company as defined under § 3–1101 of the Courts and Judicial Proceedings Article;
occupied as the principal residence of an individual serving as a member of a volunteer fire company as defined under § 3–1101 of the Courts and Judicial Proceedings Article; and
located within the jurisdiction of the municipal corporation.

paragraph.text: The municipal corporation may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the amount of a property tax credit under this subsection;
the duration of a property tax credit under this subsection; and
any other provision necessary to carry out this subsection.

subsection.text: The governing body of Charles County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: real property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by a nonprofit community or civic improvement association or corporation; and
used only for a community, civic, educational, recreational, or library purpose, if:

sub-subparagraph.text: unless the compensation is used only to improve or maintain the property, the use is not contingent on the payment of compensation for admission; and
unless the compensation is used only to improve or maintain the property, failure to pay compensation is not a reason to deny admission to or use of the property;

paragraph.text: real property that is owned by the Greater Waldorf Jaycees, Incorporated;
real property that is owned by the Southern Maryland Youth Organization, Incorporated;
agricultural land, including any farm improvement, that is located in an agricultural preservation district;
a building other than a tobacco barn that is:

subparagraph.text: located on land that qualifies for an agricultural use assessment; and
used in connection with an activity that is recognized by the Department as an approved agricultural activity;

paragraph.text: real property that is owned by Habitat for Humanity or any charitable organization holding that property with the intention of relinquishing ownership in the immediate future for charitable purposes;
subject to subsection (b) of this section, real property:

subparagraph.text: that is located in a rural legacy area as defined in § 5–9A–02 of the Natural Resources Article; and
for which the property owner has sold the development rights under the Rural Legacy Program established under Title 5, Subtitle 9A of the Natural Resources Article; and

paragraph.text: subject to subsection (c) of this section, residential real property that is located in a designated targeted area and has been converted from a rental dwelling to an owner–occupied dwelling.

subsection.text: The governing body of Charles County may provide for the conditions of eligibility and method of application for and the amount of the property tax credit authorized under subsection (a)(7) of this section.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Charles County may, by law after a public hearing, designate as eligible for the tax credit under subsection (a)(8) of this section and the recordation tax exemption authorized under § 12–114 of this article geographically defined targeted areas of the county that the governing body determines are in transition from predominantly owner–occupied homes to predominantly rental dwellings.
The governing body of Charles County may provide by law for:

subparagraph.text: any criteria for eligibility, conditions, or restrictions for a credit authorized under subsection (a)(8) of this section;
provisions to define, fix, or limit the amount, terms, scope, and duration of a credit authorized under subsection (a)(8) of this section; and
any other provision appropriate to implement the credit authorized under subsection (a)(8) of this section.

subsection.text: The governing body of Charles County may grant to new businesses locating in the county a county property tax credit for machinery and equipment used in manufacturing, assembling, processing, or refining products for sale or for new facilities in the generation of electricity and may define, fix, or limit the amount, terms, scope, and duration of any credit provided for or affirmed under this subsection.

paragraph.text: To encourage the location and development of business operations and expansion of the employment base in Charles County, the governing body of Charles County and of a municipal corporation in Charles County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county and municipal corporation property tax imposed on any property owned by a new or expanding business that creates 10 or more full–time jobs in an industry targeted for expansion by the Charles County Economic Development Commission.
A tax credit granted under this subsection may not be granted for more than 10 years.
The governing body of Charles County may grant a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on real property that was formerly used solely as a tobacco barn if the real property:

subparagraph.text: is located on land that is subject to a tobacco buyout agreement; or

sub-subparagraph.text: is located on land that qualifies for an agricultural use assessment; and
is used in connection with an activity that is recognized by the Department as an approved agricultural activity.

paragraph.text: In authorizing a credit under this subsection, the governing body of the county may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the amount of the credit;
the duration of the credit; and
any other provision necessary to administer the credit.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Charles County may grant a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on renovated or rehabilitated business real property located in a priority funding area as designated in Title 5, Subtitle 7B of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the governing body of the county may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the amount of the credit;
the duration of the credit; and
any other provision necessary to administer the credit.

paragraph.text: A tax credit under this subsection shall not exceed the amount of additional property tax assessed as a result of the renovation or rehabilitation.
A tax credit under this subsection is available to a qualified property for no more than 5 years.
The governing body of Charles County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on real property that:

subparagraph.text: is owner–occupied;
was formerly owned by Habitat for Humanity of Charles County with the intention of relinquishing ownership;
was used by Habitat for Humanity of Charles County exclusively for the purpose of rehabilitation and transfer to a private owner; and
was transferred to a private owner who meets the criteria established by Habitat for Humanity of Charles County.

paragraph.text: The property tax credit shall equal:

subparagraph.text: 100% of the county property tax for the first taxable year after the transfer of ownership;
75% of the county property tax for the second taxable year after the transfer of ownership;
50% of the county property tax for the third taxable year after the transfer of ownership;
25% of the county property tax for the fourth taxable year after the transfer of ownership; and
0% of the county property tax for the fifth taxable year after the transfer of ownership and each taxable year thereafter.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Charles County may provide, by law, for any other provision necessary to carry out the property tax credit under this subsection.

The governing body of Charles County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on real property that is subject to a perpetual conservation easement donated to the Conservancy for Charles County, Inc., or another qualified entity approved by the governing body.
The property tax credit granted under this section shall:

subparagraph.text: benefit the original grantor of the perpetual conservation easement;
be granted for the duration that the original grantor of the perpetual conservation easement continues to reside on the property subject to the easement;
terminate on transfer of the property subject to the conservation easement by the grantor; and
be applicable to preexisting conservation easements.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Charles County may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the amount and duration of the property tax credit under this subsection; and
any other provision necessary to carry out the property tax credit under this subsection.

subsection.text: The governing body of Dorchester County and of a municipal corporation in Dorchester County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county and municipal corporation property tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: property that on July 1, 1969 was owned by the Women’s Auxiliary of the Dorchester Memorial Hospital; and
property that is owned by the Cambridge Little League, Incorporated.

subsection.text: The governing body of Dorchester County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: property that is owned by the Cedar Meadows Rod and Gun Club, Incorporated; and
property that is owned by the Cambridge Skeet and Gun Club, Incorporated.

To encourage the location of warehouse plant facilities or the expansion of existing warehouse plant facilities, the governing body of Dorchester County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on the real property of commercial warehouse plant facilities if:

subparagraph.text: the property is used in connection with warehouse activities; and
the facilities have a minimum of 80,000 square feet of enclosed commercial warehouse space under a roof and within a building or buildings.

paragraph.text: A tax credit granted under this subsection may not be granted for more than 20 years.

The governing body of Dorchester County or of a municipal corporation in Dorchester County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax that is imposed on real property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc. with the intention of relinquishing ownership in the immediate future;
used exclusively for the purpose of rehabilitation and transfer to a private owner; and
not occupied by administrative or warehouse buildings owned by Habitat for Humanity.

paragraph.text: Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc. shall submit an annual written report to the governing body of Dorchester County documenting:

subparagraph.text: all of Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc.’s real property holdings in Dorchester County; and
all transactions involving Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc.’s real property holdings in Dorchester County.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Dorchester County or of a municipal corporation in Dorchester County may, by law:

subparagraph.text: set the amount, terms, scope, and duration of a credit granted under paragraph (1) of this subsection; and
adopt any provision necessary to administer a credit granted under paragraph (1) of this subsection.

subsection.text: The governing body of Dorchester County or of a municipal corporation in Dorchester County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on property that:

paragraph.text: is owned by the Chesapeake Audubon Society, Inc.; and
is used solely for:

subparagraph.text: the environmental education of the public; or
the maintenance of:

sub-subparagraph.text: a natural area for public use; or
a sanctuary for wildlife.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Dorchester County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on:

subparagraph.text: agricultural land that is subject to a nutrient management plan or that is developing a nutrient management plan for implementation;
agricultural land that:

sub-subparagraph.text: is located in an agricultural preservation district; or
is subject to an agricultural land preservation easement or similar easement; or

subparagraph.text: forest land that is subject to a forest management plan or similar agreement.

paragraph.text: In establishing a tax credit under this subsection, the governing body of Dorchester County:

subparagraph.text: shall develop criteria necessary to implement the credit; and
may specify the amount and duration of the credit, the qualification and application procedures for the credit, and any other requirement or procedure that the governing body considers appropriate.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Frederick County and of a municipal corporation in Frederick County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county and municipal corporation property tax imposed on property that:

subparagraph.text: is owned by the Frederick Optimist Boy’s Foundation, Incorporated; and
is not under a lease or rented commercially.

paragraph.text: In paragraph (1) of this subsection, commercial renting does not include the operation of a parking lot.
The governing body of Frederick County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county tax imposed on:

subparagraph.text: real property that is owned by the Emmitsburg Civic Association, Incorporated; and
real property on which an improvement is made to an existing structure that is located in a historic district.

paragraph.text: A property tax credit granted under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection shall be:

subparagraph.text: the following percentage of the increase that is due to the improvement:

sub-subparagraph.text: 100% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 1st and 2nd taxable years that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax;
80% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 3rd taxable year that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax;
60% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 4th taxable year that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax; and
40% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 5th taxable year that the structure is subject to the county property tax; and

subparagraph.text: ended after the 5th taxable year that the improved structure is subject to county property tax.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Frederick County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on:

subparagraph.text: real property that is owned by Ruritan National;
real property that is owned by any Ruritan club that is affiliated with Ruritan National;
real property that is owned by a nonprofit community or civic association or corporation and is used only for:

sub-subparagraph.text: a community, civic, educational, or recreational purpose; or
the conservation or preservation of wildlife; or

subparagraph.text: real property owned by the Audubon Society of Central Maryland, Inc. and appurtenant to the premises of the Audubon Society of Central Maryland, Inc., if the property is used only for:

sub-subparagraph.text: the maintenance of a natural area for public use;
a sanctuary for wildlife;
the environmental education of the public; or
the general management of wildlife.

paragraph.text: Unless the compensation is used only to improve or maintain the real property, the use of the real property under paragraph (1)(iii) of this subsection may not be contingent on the payment of compensation.

Unless the compensation is used only to improve or maintain the real property, the real property under paragraph (1)(iii) of this subsection may not be granted a property tax credit if failure to pay compensation is a reason to deny admission to or use of the property.

subsection.text: The governing body of Frederick County and of a municipal corporation in Frederick County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is:

paragraph.text: leased to the Frederick County Board of County Commissioners or to the Frederick County Board of Education; and
used exclusively for public school educational purposes.

subsection.text: The governing body of Frederick County and of a municipal corporation in Frederick County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is:

paragraph.text: leased to a nonprofit school; and
used exclusively for primary or secondary educational purposes.

subsection.text: A taxpayer may apply for a property tax credit under this section on or before October 1 of the taxable year.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, “agricultural preservation land” means:

subparagraph.text: real property subject to an easement or other interest that is permanently conveyed or assigned to preserve the agricultural use of the real property; or
real property that the governing body of Frederick County has designated as being within an agricultural preservation district.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Frederick County may grant, by law, a property tax credit of up to 100% of any county property tax imposed on agricultural preservation land.
The governing body of Frederick County may provide, by law, for any procedural or enforcement provisions necessary to carry out this subsection.
Valuation and assessment of agricultural preservation land shall be made in the same manner as any other real property in the county.
The governing body of Frederick County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on a building that is:

subparagraph.text: located on land that qualifies for an agricultural use assessment; and
used in connection with an activity that is recognized by the Department as an approved agricultural activity.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Frederick County:

subparagraph.text: shall develop criteria necessary to implement the credit;
shall designate an agency to administer the credit; and
may specify:

sub-subparagraph.text: the amount and duration of the credit;
the qualifications and application procedures for the credit; and
any other requirement or procedure for granting or administration of the credit.

subparagraph.text: In this subsection the following words have the meanings indicated.
“Affiliate” means a person:

sub-subparagraph.text: that directly or indirectly owns at least 80% of a business entity; or
at least 80% of which is owned, directly or indirectly, by a business entity.

subparagraph.text: “Business entity” means a person conducting a trade or business in the State that is subject to the State individual or corporate income tax or insurance premiums tax.
“Full–time position” means a position requiring at least 840 hours of an individual’s time during at least 24 weeks in a 6–month period.

“New or expanded premises” means commercial or industrial real property, including a building or part of a building that has not been previously occupied, where a business entity or its affiliates locate to conduct business.

sub-subparagraph.text: “New permanent full–time position” means a position that is:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: a full–time position of indefinite duration;
located in Frederick County;
newly created, as a result of the establishment or expansion of a business facility in the county; and
filled.

sub-subparagraph.text: “New permanent full–time position” does not include a position that is:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: created when an employment function is shifted from an existing business facility of the business entity or its affiliates located in Frederick County to another business facility of the same business entity or its affiliates, if the position does not represent a net new job in the county;
created through a change in ownership of a trade or business;
created through a consolidation, merger, or restructuring of a business entity or its affiliates, if the position does not represent a net new job in the county;

created when an employment function is contractually shifted from an existing business entity or its affiliates located in the county to another business entity or its affiliates, if the position does not represent a net new job in the county; or
filled for a period of less than 12 months.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Frederick County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on real property owned or leased by a business entity that meets the requirements specified for the tax credit under this subsection.

To qualify for a property tax credit under this subsection, before a business entity obtains the new or expanded premises or hires employees to fill the new permanent full–time positions at the new or expanded premises, the business entity shall provide written notification to the governing body of Frederick County stating:

subparagraph.text: that the business entity intends to claim the property tax credit; and
when the business entity expects to obtain the new or expanded premises and hire the required number of employees in the new permanent full–time positions.
To qualify for a property tax credit under this subsection, an existing business entity in the county shall:

sub-subparagraph.text: obtain at least an additional 1,500 square feet of new or expanded premises by purchasing newly constructed premises, constructing new premises, causing new premises to be constructed, or leasing previously unoccupied premises; and
employ at least one individual in a new permanent full–time position during a 12–month period, during which period the business entity also must obtain and occupy the new or expanded premises.

subparagraph.text: To qualify for the property tax credit under this subsection, a new business entity locating in the county shall:

sub-subparagraph.text: obtain at least 2,500 square feet of new or expanded premises by purchasing newly constructed premises, constructing new premises, causing new premises to be constructed, or leasing previously unoccupied premises; and
employ at least five individuals in new permanent full–time positions during a 24–month period, during which period the business entity also must obtain and occupy the new or expanded premises.

subparagraph.text: If an existing business entity in the county meets the requirements of paragraph (4)(i) of this subsection, the property tax credit granted under this subsection shall equal a percentage of the amount of property tax imposed on the assessment of the new or expanded premises, as follows:

sub-subparagraph.text: 52% in the 1st and 2nd taxable years;
39% in the 3rd and 4th taxable years; and
26% in the 5th and 6th taxable years.

subparagraph.text: If a new business entity locating in the county meets the requirements of paragraph (4)(ii) of this subsection, the property tax credit granted under this subsection shall equal a percentage of the amount of property tax imposed on the assessment of the new or expanded premises, as follows:

sub-subparagraph.text: 30% in the 1st and 2nd taxable years;
20% in the 3rd and 4th taxable years; and
10% in the 5th and 6th taxable years.

paragraph.text: The lessor of real property granted a property tax credit under this subsection shall reduce the amount of taxes for which a business entity is contractually liable under the lease agreement by the amount of any credit granted under this subsection for improvements made by the business entity.
The governing body of Frederick County shall provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the specific requirements for eligibility for a property tax credit authorized under this subsection;
any additional limitations on eligibility for the credit; and
any other provision appropriate to implement the credit.

paragraph.text: Except as provided under paragraph (2) of this subsection, a property tax credit granted under this section shall continue until the property is conveyed.
A property tax credit granted under subsection (d), (e), or (g) of this section shall continue as long as the property is in compliance with the terms of that subsection.

subsection.text: The governing body of Garrett County and of a municipal corporation in Garrett County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county and municipal corporation property tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by the Maryland Ornithological Society, Incorporated; and
known as the Carey Run Sanctuary;

paragraph.text: property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by the Swanton Community Center, Incorporated;
known as the Swanton Community Center; and
used only for community, civic, or educational purposes;

paragraph.text: property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by the Crellin Community Center, Incorporated;
known as the Crellin Community Center; and
used only for community, civic, or educational purposes;

paragraph.text: property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by the Bittinger Community Center, Incorporated;
known as the Bittinger Community Center; and
used only for community, civic, or educational purposes; and

paragraph.text: property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by the Garrett County Agricultural Fair Association, Incorporated; and
used only for the purposes of the Association.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on property that is:

subparagraph.text: leased and occupied by the Grantsville Volunteer Fire Department; and
used only for the purposes of the Grantsville Volunteer Fire Department.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County may grant, by law, a property tax credit for property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by the Board of Governors of Garrett County Memorial Hospital; and
undeveloped, for use by the hospital, or under a lease with the hospital to provide health care related services on a nonprofit basis.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on property that is owned by the Avilton Community Association, Inc.

subparagraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section of up to 100% of the county property tax imposed on agricultural land that is located in an agricultural land preservation district.
In authorizing a credit under subparagraph (i) of this paragraph, the governing body of the county may:

sub-subparagraph.text: set the amount and duration of the tax credit;
adopt any provision necessary to administer the credit; and
provide any restriction or condition considered desirable on the credit.

subparagraph.text: In establishing a credit under subparagraph (i) of this paragraph, the governing body of the county may provide that a property owner who has been granted a property tax credit under this paragraph and who subsequently withdraws the property from the agricultural land preservation district shall be liable for:

sub-subparagraph.text: all property taxes that the owner would have been liable for on the withdrawn property if the property tax credit had not been granted; and
interest at a rate established by the governing body of the county on the property tax liability under item 1 of this subparagraph.

subparagraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on property that is owned by the Garrett County, Maryland, Community Action Committee, Inc. or by an entity in which the Garrett County, Maryland, Community Action Committee, Inc. has a controlling interest.
In authorizing a credit under subparagraph (i) of this paragraph, the governing body of the county may:

sub-subparagraph.text: set the amount and duration of the tax credit;
limit eligibility for the tax credit to particular parcels of property; and
adopt any other provision necessary to administer the credit.

subparagraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the property tax imposed on property that is owned by Adventure Sports Center, Inc.
In authorizing a credit under subparagraph (i) of this paragraph, the governing body of the county may:

sub-subparagraph.text: set the amount and duration of the tax credit;
provide for additional eligibility criteria for the tax credit;
provide for regulations and procedures for the administration of requests for the tax credit; and
adopt any other provision necessary to administer the credit.

subparagraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property that is new construction or an improvement to real property owned or occupied by a commercial or industrial business that:

sub-subparagraph.text: is currently or will be doing business in Garrett County;

will employ additional full–time local employees in the county by the second year in which the credit is allowed, not including any employee filling a job created when a job function is shifted from an existing location in the State to the location of the new construction or improvement; and
makes a substantial investment in Garrett County.

subparagraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County, by law, may:

sub-subparagraph.text: specify the minimum investment or job creation requirements for qualification for the credit;
designate an agency to administer the credit; and
specify:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: the amount and duration of the credit;
application procedures for the credit; and
any additional criteria for eligibility or any other requirement or procedure for the granting or administration of the credit that the governing body considers appropriate.

subparagraph.text: A property tax credit under this paragraph may not exceed the amount of county property tax imposed on the increase in assessment that is due to the new construction or improvements made to the property of the person applying for the credit.
If a property tax credit under this paragraph is granted for property leased or rented by a commercial or industrial business:

sub-subparagraph.text: the amount of the tax credit allowed shall pass through to the commercial or industrial business that conducts the activity that qualifies for the credit; and
the term of the tax credit may not exceed the term of the lease and may not exceed 10 years.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by the Society for the Preservation of St. Ann Mission; and
known as St. Ann Mission.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County or of a municipal corporation in Garrett County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on:

subparagraph.text: personal property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: used for residential rental purposes; and
located in a building that is used for residential rental purposes; and

subparagraph.text: part or all of the real and personal property of any distribution and warehousing facility that:

sub-subparagraph.text: locates in the county or municipal corporation; or
expands in the county or municipal corporation.

paragraph.text: The law adopted under paragraph (1)(i) of this subsection shall specify:

subparagraph.text: the qualifications for the tax credit;
the amount of the tax credit; and
the duration of the tax credit.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Garrett County or of a municipal corporation in Garrett County may:

subparagraph.text: set, by law, the amount and duration of the tax credit under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection;
adopt any provision necessary to administer the credit under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection; and
provide any other restriction or condition considered desirable on the credit under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Harford County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on:

subparagraph.text: real property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: owned by any incorporated community association:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: whose membership is limited to voluntary subscriptions of the residents of the community or development; and
that may not assess a fee against a resident or property owner based on property values; and

sub-subparagraph.text: used as a public park, playground, or picnic area;

subparagraph.text: property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: owned by the Habonim Camp Association Company, Incorporated;
used only for the purposes of the Habonim Camp Association Company; and
in excess of the property exempted under § 7–202 of this article;

subparagraph.text: property that is owned by the Maryland Ornithological Society, Incorporated;
real property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: owned by the North Harford Game and Fish Association, Incorporated;
located on Wheeler School Road; and
used only for the purposes of the association;

subparagraph.text: real property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: owned by the trustees of the Ladew Topiary Gardens;
located on Jarrettsville Pike;
used only for the purposes of the Ladew Topiary Gardens; and
in excess of the property exempted under § 7–202 of this article;

subparagraph.text: real property that:

sub-subparagraph.text: is used primarily for an agricultural purpose; and
does not have an agricultural use assessment;

subparagraph.text: real property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: used primarily for amateur sports events; and
owned by the Havre de Grace Little League, Incorporated;

subparagraph.text: real property, only after July 1, 1988, that:

sub-subparagraph.text: is located in an agricultural district under an original or renewed agreement to be located within an agricultural district; or
becomes subject to an agricultural preservation easement that has been conveyed to the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation;

subparagraph.text: real property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: owned by a Harford County volunteer fire or ambulance company;
held for the future use as a station or substation site, as approved by the Harford County Volunteer Fire and Ambulance Association in their 5–year plan; and
not exempt under § 7–209 of this article;

subparagraph.text: subject to the condition established under paragraph (4) of this subsection, owner–occupied residential real property:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: whose structural boundaries are within 1,000 feet of a refuse disposal system for which an active permit has been issued to the Harford County government under § 9–204 of the Environment Article;
that was completed on or before June 1, 2010, and is located within the boundaries of Trimble Road, Magnolia Road, Fort Hoyle Road, and Aberdeen Proving Ground property; or
that was completed on or before June 1, 2010, and is located within 250 feet to the west of Fort Hoyle Road, south of parcel no. 01015060, and north of Aberdeen Proving Ground property; and

sub-subparagraph.text: that is determined by the governing body of Harford County to have been adversely impacted by its proximity to the refuse disposal system;

subparagraph.text: real property, only after July 1, 1993, that:

sub-subparagraph.text: is located in the Harford County Agricultural District in accordance with the Harford County Agricultural Land Preservation Program under Chapter 60 of the Harford County Code; or

becomes subject to an agricultural preservation easement that has been conveyed to Harford County in accordance with the Harford County Agricultural Land Preservation Program, under Chapter 60 of the Harford County Code;

subparagraph.text: subject to paragraph (6) of this subsection, real property that is new construction or a substantial improvement to the real property of a commercial or industrial business that:

sub-subparagraph.text: is or will be doing business in Harford County; and
will employ at least 12 additional full–time local employees by the second year the credit is allowed;

subparagraph.text: subject to paragraph (7) of this subsection, real property:

sub-subparagraph.text: that is located in a Rural Legacy Area as defined in § 5–9A–02 of the Natural Resources Article; and
for which the property owner has sold the development rights under the Rural Legacy Program established under Title 5, Subtitle 9A of the Natural Resources Article; and

subparagraph.text: real property:

sub-subparagraph.text: that is adjacent to property that is:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: operated as a family farm; and

located in the Harford County Agricultural District or is subject to an agricultural preservation easement that has been conveyed to Harford County or to the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation;

sub-subparagraph.text: that was subdivided from the adjacent property, withdrawn from the agricultural district or agricultural easement, and conveyed to a child of the owner of the adjacent property under a child lot exclusion to build a home on the property; and
the owner of which:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: is a child of the owner of the adjacent property; and
continues to help operate the adjacent property as a family farm.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Harford County shall adopt procedures that govern the amount of and the conditions of eligibility and method of application for the property tax credit granted under paragraph (1)(vi) of this subsection. The amount of the property tax credit may not be more than the amount of property tax on real property that is associated with the difference between the actual assessment of the land and the maximum allowable agricultural use assessment that the Department establishes.

subparagraph.text: A property owner is not eligible for a tax credit for real property under paragraph (1)(viii) of this subsection, and any such tax credit granted shall terminate, if the property owner terminates the agricultural district agreement or the agricultural preservation easement.

A property owner who has been granted a property tax credit for real property under paragraph (1)(viii) of this subsection, and who subsequently terminates the agricultural preservation district agreement or the agricultural preservation easement shall be liable for all property taxes that the owner would have been liable for if a property tax credit had not been granted under this section for a period not exceeding 3 years from the date that the agricultural district agreement was recorded.
In this paragraph, “environmental surcharges” means tipping fees that:

sub-subparagraph.text: are paid to the county by the user of a refuse disposal system; and
have been set at a specific amount per ton of refuse that is deposited at the site of the disposal system.

subparagraph.text: A property tax credit may not be granted under paragraph (1)(x) of this subsection unless the governing body of Harford County approves the use of environmental surcharges to offset the total amount of the property tax credits granted.

A property owner is not eligible for a tax credit for real property under paragraph (1)(xi) of this subsection and any such tax credit granted shall terminate if the property owner withdraws the property from the Harford County Agricultural District.

A property owner who has been granted a property tax credit for real property under paragraph (1)(xi) of this subsection, and who subsequently withdraws the property from the Agricultural Preservation District shall be liable for all property taxes that the owner would have been liable for if a property tax credit had not been granted.

paragraph.text: Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph, the governing body of Harford County may:

subparagraph.text: provide for the amount of and the conditions of eligibility and method of application for the property tax credit authorized under paragraph (1)(xii) of this subsection;
review compliance with the conditions of the property tax credit annually; and
eliminate the credit for any taxpayer if the terms and conditions of the credit are not met.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Harford County may provide for the conditions of eligibility and method of application for and the amount of the property tax credit authorized under paragraph (1)(xiii) of this subsection.

The governing body of Harford County or of a municipal corporation in Harford County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned by any person who:

sub-subparagraph.text: constructs a housing structure; or
operates a housing project;

subparagraph.text: used for a housing structure or project which may contain a community service facility;
a structure constructed or substantially rehabilitated under § 8 of the United States Housing Act of 1937 primarily for occupancy by elderly individuals;
receiving rent subsidy; and
operated on a nonprofit or limited distribution basis.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Harford County and of a municipal corporation in Harford County, where applicable, shall make an agreement with the owner of property for which a property tax credit is granted under paragraph (1) of this subsection to pay negotiated amounts instead of all county or municipal corporation property taxes. Where applicable, the amount paid shall be apportioned between Harford County and the municipal corporation.

The governing body of a municipal corporation in Harford County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property located within the jurisdiction of the municipal corporation that is owned and occupied as the principal residence of an individual serving as a member of a:

subparagraph.text: volunteer fire company;
volunteer ambulance company; or
ladies’ auxiliary of a volunteer fire company or volunteer ambulance company.

paragraph.text: The municipal corporation may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the amount of a property tax credit under this subsection;
the duration of a property tax credit under this subsection; and
any other provision necessary to carry out this subsection.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, “facility” means a continuing care facility for the aged that:

subparagraph.text: provides continuing care as defined in § 10–401 of the Human Services Article;
is licensed as a related institution under Title 19, Subtitle 3 of the Health – General Article;
is certified by the Department of Aging; and

is exempt from federal income tax under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code or is owned or operated by a person that is exempt from federal income tax under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Harford County or of a municipal corporation in Harford County may grant, by law, a tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on property that is:

subparagraph.text: owned or operated by a facility or by a person that is exempt from federal income tax under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code; and
available for use in connection with a facility.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Harford County or of a municipal corporation in Harford County may provide, by law, for:

subparagraph.text: the amount and duration of the tax credit under this subsection;
additional eligibility criteria for the tax credit under this subsection;
regulations and procedures for the application and uniform processing of requests for the tax credit; and
any other provision necessary to carry out the credit under this subsection.

subsection.text: The governing body of Howard County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: property that:

subparagraph.text: is owned by any community association;
is used for community, civic, educational, library, or park purposes; and
is not a swimming pool, tennis court, or similar recreational facility;

paragraph.text: real property that is subject to the county’s agricultural land preservation program;
subject to subsections (b) and (c) of this section, real property that is new construction or an improvement to real property owned or occupied by a commercial or industrial business that:

subparagraph.text: is currently or will be doing business in Howard County;

will employ at least 12 additional full–time local employees by the second year in which the credit is allowed, not including any employee filling a job created when a job function is shifted from an existing location in the State to the location of the new construction or improvement; and
makes a substantial investment in Howard County, which may be:

sub-subparagraph.text: the acquisition of a building, land, or equipment that totals at least $2,000,000; or
the creation of 10 positions with salaries greater than the current average annual wage in Howard County;

paragraph.text: subject to subsection (b) of this section, real property that is used as a therapeutic riding facility by a nonprofit organization that:

subparagraph.text: is exempt from taxation under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code;
provides services to disabled individuals; and
has at least 85% of its clients who are disabled individuals; and

paragraph.text: subject to subsection (b) of this section, owner–occupied residential real property that is jointly owned by an individual and the Howard County Housing Commission.

subsection.text: In establishing a tax credit under subsection (a)(3) through (5) of this section, the governing body of Howard County:

paragraph.text: shall develop criteria necessary to implement the credit;
shall designate an agency to administer the credit; and
may specify:

subparagraph.text: the amount and duration of the credit;
the qualifications and application procedures for the credit; and
any other requirement or procedure for the granting or administration of the credit that the governing body considers appropriate.

paragraph.text: A property tax credit under subsection (a)(3) of this section may not exceed the amount of county property tax imposed on the increase in assessment that is due to the new construction or improvements made to the property of the person applying for the credit.
If a property tax credit under subsection (a)(3) of this section is granted for property leased or rented by a commercial or industrial business allowed under this subsection:

subparagraph.text: the amount of the tax credit allowed shall pass through to the commercial or industrial business that conducts the activity that qualifies for the credit; and
the term of the tax credit may not exceed the term of the lease and may not exceed 10 years.

subsection.text: The governing body of Montgomery County and of a municipal corporation in Montgomery County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county and municipal corporation property tax imposed on:

paragraph.text: personal property that is owned by a nonprofit, nonstock cooperative housing corporation; and
real property that is:

subparagraph.text: leased, if the payment to the lessor under the lease is limited to:

sub-subparagraph.text: interest;
amortization of the mortgage; and
expenses that do not include profit or return to the lessor of investment in the real property;

subparagraph.text: used only as a theater that contains at least 175 seats; and

used by a nonprofit community theatrical organization that, except for any clerical or maintenance employee, does not have any paid officer, director, or employee. The organization may be required by the governing body to pay an annual charge for any actual public service rendered.

paragraph.text: The governing body of Montgomery County or of a municipal corporation in Montgomery County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on:

subparagraph.text: real property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: a structure or project constructed or substantially rehabilitated under § 8 of the United States Housing Act of 1937 primarily for occupancy by elderly individuals;
receiving a rent subsidy;
operated on a nonprofit or limited dividend distribution basis; and

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: located in an area designated by the governing body of Montgomery County or of the municipal corporation in Montgomery County as a commercial revitalization district; and

on application of the property owner, certified by the Montgomery County Department of Housing and Community Development or the municipal corporation department responsible for certification, whichever is applicable, as meeting the qualifications for a tax credit pursuant to the criteria established by Montgomery County or a municipal corporation in Montgomery County under paragraph (3) of this subsection; and

subparagraph.text: personal property that is used to improve, replace, or maintain a road, common area, or common facility that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: owned by a nonprofit organization that is formed only to improve, replace, or maintain the road, common area, or common facility;
established under a town sector, planned retirement community zone, or planned residential community zone of an enacted county zoning ordinance; and
dedicated for the use of all the residents without payment of fee or admission.

paragraph.text: The amount of a property tax credit granted under paragraph (1)(i)4 of this subsection may not exceed 25% of the county property tax or the municipal corporation property tax due on the property.

The governing body of Montgomery County or of the municipal corporation shall specify the qualifications for eligibility and conditions of certification for the tax credit under paragraph (1)(i)4 of this subsection.

On application of the governing body of a municipal corporation and approval by the governing body of Montgomery County, the property eligible for a credit against the municipal corporation property tax, under this subsection, shall also receive a credit against the county property tax.
The governing body of Montgomery County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on:

subparagraph.text: real property on which an improvement is made to an existing structure in a neighborhood improvement plan area that the governing body of Montgomery County determines to be a special target area for residential, business, and community redevelopment because of blight or deterioration;
real property that is:

sub-subparagraph.text: owned by Bannockburn Cooperators, Incorporated;
leased by Bannockburn Community Club, Incorporated; and
used only for community, civic, educational, and recreational purposes and to promote social welfare; or

subparagraph.text: real property for which the county has determined there are development impact tax credits that exceed the amount that can be used under county law.

paragraph.text: A property tax credit granted under paragraph (1)(i) of this subsection shall be:

subparagraph.text: a percentage of the actual cost of the improvements as the governing body of Montgomery County determines for the 1st 4 taxable years that the improved property is subject to county property tax; and
not allowed after the 1st 4 taxable years that the improved property is subject to property tax.

subsection.text: The governing body of Montgomery County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on the portion of real property that is owned by the American Association of Blood Banks, Incorporated or leased by the American Association of Blood Banks, Incorporated under a lease of 50 years or more and that is necessary for and actually used exclusively for the charitable or educational purposes of that organization.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, “dwelling unit” means a building or portion of a building providing complete living facilities for not more than one family, including, at a minimum, facilities for cooking, sanitation, and sleeping.

The governing body of Montgomery County may grant, by law, to a total of 1,500 dwelling units, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on owner-occupied, residential real property that is purchased from July 1, 2000 through June 30, 2002, in specific geographic areas of Montgomery County that:

subparagraph.text: contain not fewer than 50 dwelling units; and
are designated by the County Executive of Montgomery County for participation in a demonstration project for neighborhood preservation and stabilization.

paragraph.text: In order to qualify for the credit under this subsection:

subparagraph.text: for the 12-month period immediately prior to purchasing the property, the individual’s principal residence may not have been located in the geographic areas designated under this subsection, unless the individual was not an owner of the property that was the individual’s principal residence; and
the residential real property must have been purchased in conformance with regulations adopted by the County Executive that are approved by the County Council.

paragraph.text: The property tax credit shall equal:

subparagraph.text: 40% of the county property tax for each of the first 5 taxable years after the purchase of the real property;
35% of the county property tax for the 6th taxable year after the purchase of the real property;
30% of the county property tax for the 7th taxable year after the purchase of the real property;
25% of the county property tax for the 8th taxable year after the purchase of the real property;
20% of the county property tax for the 9th taxable year after the purchase of the real property;
15% of the county property tax for the 10th taxable year after the purchase of the real property; and
0% of the county property tax for each taxable year thereafter.

paragraph.text: The property tax credit shall first apply to the taxable year beginning after the date of the purchase of the eligible real property.
The governing body of Montgomery County may provide, by law, for any other provision necessary to carry out the property tax credit under this subsection.

subparagraph.text: The County Executive of Montgomery County shall hold a public hearing prior to the final designation of the geographic areas under paragraph (2) of this subsection.
Designation of geographic areas shall be made by regulation adopted by the County Executive and approved by the County Council.
A geographic area may be designated within a municipality only with the approval of the municipality’s governing body.

paragraph.text: The Montgomery County Department of Finance shall provide, on an annual basis to those individuals qualifying for the property tax credit under this subsection, a statement certifying qualification for the property tax credit and the amount of the property tax credit being granted. The statement may be provided on or with the annual property tax bill or in another manner as chosen by the local government.

In order to be eligible for a property tax credit under this subsection, an individual shall apply for the credit within 6 months after the title to the residential property has been transferred to the individual.

subparagraph.text: The property tax credit granted under this subsection terminates on the sale of the residential real property granted the credit.

A property owner who purchases residential real property for which the property tax credit has been terminated under this paragraph may apply for, and may be granted, a separate property tax credit if the property owner and the residential real property otherwise meet the conditions of this subsection.
In this subsection the following words have the meanings indicated.
“Eligible business entity” means a person who operates or conducts a trade or business on qualified enterprise zone property but does not own the qualified enterprise zone property.
“Qualified enterprise zone property” means real property that:

sub-subparagraph.text: is not used for residential purposes;
is used in a trade or business by an eligible business entity;
is located in an enterprise zone that is designated under Title 5, Subtitle 7 of the Economic Development Article; and
is eligible for the property tax credit under § 9–103 of this title.

paragraph.text: Subject to paragraphs (4) and (5) of this subsection, the governing body of Montgomery County or of a municipal corporation in Montgomery County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on:

subparagraph.text: improvements made by an eligible business entity to qualified enterprise zone property; and
personal property owned by an eligible business entity located on qualified enterprise zone property.
The governing body of Montgomery County or of a municipal corporation in Montgomery County may provide, by law, for:

sub-subparagraph.text: the amount and duration of a credit under this subsection;
additional eligibility criteria for a credit under this subsection; and
any other provision necessary to carry out a credit under this subsection.

subparagraph.text: The governing body of Montgomery County or of a municipal corporation in Montgomery County shall define, by law, the improvements eligible for a credit under this subsection.

paragraph.text: The lessor of real property granted a credit under paragraph (2)(i) of this subsection shall reduce the amount of taxes for which an eligible business entity is contractually liable under the lease agreement by the amount of any credit granted under paragraph (2)(i) of this subsection for improvements made by the eligible business entity.
The lessor of real property that receives a credit under § 9–103 of this title may not be granted a credit under this subsection.

subparagraph.text: In this subsection the following words have the meanings indicated.
“Benefit corporation” means a Maryland corporation that elects to be a benefit corporation and complies with Title 5, Subtitle 6C of the Corporations and Associations Article.
